intro: Michelaria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy michelaria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Michelaria hirsuta is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
